Context:
* The current application processing time is approximately 4+ weeks.
* Applications for the program intakes in January 2024, May 2024, September 2024, and January 2025 can be submitted during specific periods, with offer issuance beginning on different dates. For example:
  - January 2024 intake: Intake open for submission of applications from April 3, 2023, Offer issuance begins on August 8, 2023, and the first day of classes is on January 8, 2024.
* Applications for conditional admission through English for Academic Purposes (EAP) will be processed throughout the year according to the EAP start dates.
* George Brown College processes international applications selectively based on academic quality, program capacity, and institutional diversity goals.
* The college is committed to ensuring diversity within their international student population and aims to represent a wide range of regions and countries.
* Not all applicants who meet the minimum requirements will be admitted due to limited capacity in programs.
* The college maintains a network of authorized international agents to aid prospective students through their application process.

Context:
The text provides information on the role of international agents in the application process at George Brown College, application review process, required documents for a complete application, fees for application deferrals, communication after receiving an offer, availability of programs for international students, and confirmation of admission requirements. There is no explicit mention of specific programs offered by the college in the text.

EXTRACTED INFORMATION:
- George Brown College has a network of authorized international agents.
- Some agents charge fees for visa counselling.
- Prospective students are encouraged to ask about fees in advance.
- George Brown College does not process applications from unauthorized agents.
- Applications will be reviewed by admissions officers once the admissions cycle begins.
- Complete applications with all required documents and payments will be prioritized.
- A Letter of Acceptance (LOA) is required for Study Permit (visa) application.
- Application processing does not provide ongoing updates or allow reopening.
- Recruitment representatives can be contacted for questions about the application process.
- Not all programs are available to international students, eligibility should be confirmed before applying.
- Meeting admission requirements is necessary to be admitted into a post-secondary program of choice.
- Application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, and tours can be kept up to date by visiting the contact page.
- An additional $95 application fee may be required for application deferrals.
